content.value_statement: AI-generated text often sounds robotic with predictable phrases and structures. This skill identifies and eliminates common AI writing patterns to create more natural, human-sounding prose. Perfect for editing, drafting, or reviewing any text.
actual_capabilities: Identify throat-clearing openers like 'here is the thing' and 'let me be clear'
Flag formulaic structures including binary contrasts and dramatic fragmentation
Eliminate business jargon and replace with plain language
Vary sentence rhythm and break monotony in text flow
Cut emphasis crutches such as 'period full stop' and 'let that sink in'
Remove rhetorical setups and meta-commentary from prose
limitations: Does not check grammar, spelling, or punctuation errors
Does not evaluate factual accuracy or argument quality
Does not generate new content, only refines existing text

use_cases.title: Edit AI drafts
use_cases.description: Transform AI-generated first drafts into natural-sounding prose that passes AI detection tools.

use_cases.title: Polish documentation
use_cases.description: Remove robotic patterns from technical documentation while preserving clarity and accuracy.

use_cases.title: Humanize AI assistance
use_cases.description: Use AI writing assistance while maintaining an authentic human voice in your content.

prompt_templates.title: Quick edit
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply stop-slop rules to this text. Remove AI patterns like throat-clearing openers, formulaic structures, and emphasis crutches.

prompt_templates.title: Before submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this text for AI tells. Look for binary contrasts, dramatic fragmentation, rhetorical setups, and filler adverbs.

prompt_templates.title: Style guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply stop-slop scoring. Rate 1-10 on directness, rhythm, trust, authenticity, and density. Target 35/50 minimum.

prompt_templates.title: Complete rewrite
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this text using stop-slop principles. Cut all filler phrases. Break formulaic structures. Vary sentence length. Trust the reader.

output_examples.input: Here's the thing: building products is hard. Not because the technology is complex. Because people are complex. Let that sink in.
output: Building products is hard. Technology is manageable. People aren't.
Cut emphasis crutch 'Let that sink in'

best_practices: Apply stop-slop before finalizing any AI-assisted writing
Use the scoring rubric to systematically evaluate draft quality
Review the banned phrases and structures list to internalize patterns
anti_patterns: Leaving throat-clearing openers that announce rather than deliver
Using binary contrasts that create false drama in straightforward content
Ending every paragraph with a punchy one-liner for artificial emphasis

faq.question: Does this make text completely AI undetectable?
faq.answer: No. This skill reduces obvious AI patterns but comprehensive AI detection requires additional approaches.

faq.question: Does stop-slop work for technical documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. Remove robotic patterns while preserving accuracy and clarity in technical content.

faq.question: How long does it take to apply these rules?
faq.answer: Quick edits take seconds. Full rewrites of long content may require multiple passes.

faq.question: Can I use this with other writing skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Apply stop-slop after grammar tools and before final review of your content.

faq.question: What is the scoring system?
faq.answer: Rate 1-10 on directness, rhythm, trust, authenticity, and density. Target 35/50 minimum.

faq.question: Does this work for all writing styles?
faq.answer: Best for professional prose. Creative writing may intentionally use some patterns for effect.
